subject: Re: [junit] WhichJUnit is used but what about the excluded.properties?
msgSnippet: ... Try just using the one already there. If you encounter problems, then copy that file and edit it as needed (see the JUnit FAQ for details), then place it
messageBody:
ceidkeeper@... wrote:

> I have succesfully used WhichJUnit and got the junit to install
> ok,except for the last section about the excluded.properties
> file.What custom excluded.properties file should i put into
> myjunit\junit\runner folder?How can i make it?
>
> The one that is located inside the kunit.jar file is not appropriate?
> What should i do?

Try just using the one already there. If you encounter problems, then
copy that file and edit it as needed (see the JUnit FAQ for details),
then place it in any directory /before/ junit.jar on your class path.

Good luck.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
